WebTransportError.summary: The WebTransportError interface of the {{domxref("WebTransport API", "WebTransport API", "", "nocode")}} represents an error related to the API, which can arise from server errors, network connection problems, or client-initiated abort operations (for example, arising from a call).

WebTransportErrorSource.summary: The source read-only property of the interface returns an enumerated value indicating the source of the error.
WebTransportErrorSource.value: An enumerated value; can be either stream or session.

WebTransportErrorWebTransportError.summary: The WebTransportError() constructor creates a new object instance.

WebTransportErrorStreamErrorCode.summary: The streamErrorCode read-only property of the interface returns a number in the range 0-255 indicating the application protocol error code for this error, or null if one is not available.
